knimeNode.name: RDKit Add Conformers
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a new table with multiple conformers per input molecule.

fullDescription.intro: Creates a new table with multiple conformers per input molecule. Each conformer is a copy of the molecule with different coordinates assigned. Each conformer row is mapped back to the input table molecule with an identifier - usually the row id - taken from an input table column.

tab.name: Input

option.name: RDKit Mol column

tab.option: The input column with RDKit Molecules.

option.name: Reference column (e.g. an ID)

tab.option: The input column with reference data to be assigned to conformer rows.

tab.name: Conformer Calculation

option.name: Number of conformers

tab.option: Number of conformers to be generated.

option.name: Maximum number of tries to generate conformers

tab.option: Maximum number of tries that the RDKit will use to generate conformers.

option.name: Random seed

tab.option: A random seed to initialize random number generator.

option.name: RMS threshold for keeping a conformer

tab.option: The RMS threshold for keeping a conformer.

tab.name: Output

option.name: Column name for molecules with conformers

tab.option: The output column with the generated conformers.

option.name: Column name for copied reference data

tab.option: The output column with reference data taken from the input table.

tab.name: Advanced

option.name: Enforce the preservation of input chirality

tab.option: Ensures that the chirality/bond stereochemistry specified in the input structures is reflected in the conformers.

option.name: Use experimental torsion angle terms

tab.option: Use data from experimental crystal structures to refine some torsion angles. This uses the "ET" method described in https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jcim.5b00654 and https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jcim.0c00025 .

option.name: Experimental torsion angles version

tab.option: Choose the version of the experimental torsion definitions to use. Possible values are 1 and 2.

option.name: Use experimental torsion angle terms for small rings

tab.option: Use data from experimental crystal structures to refine some torsion angles in small rings. This uses the "srET" method described in https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jcim.0c00025 .

option.name: Use experimental torsion angle terms for macrocycles

tab.option: Use data from experimental crystal structures to refine some torsion angles in macrocycles. This uses the method described in https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jcim.0c00025 .

option.name: Use 1-4 distance bound heuristics for macrocycles

tab.option: Use empirical corrections to modify 1-4 distance bounds in macrocycles. T his uses the method described in https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jcim.0c00025 .

option.name: Use basic knowledge terms

tab.option: Apply "basic knowledge" constraints to planarize atoms which should be planar (e.g. aromatic atoms, conjugated atoms). This uses the "K" method described in https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jcim.5b00654 .

option.name: Force amide bonds to be trans

tab.option: Applies constraints to force amide, ester, and related bonds to have trans configurations.

option.name: Only use heavy atoms when calculating RMS values

tab.option: When doing RMS pruning only heavy atoms will be used to calculate RMS.

option.name: Use molecular symmetry when pruning conformers

tab.option: When doing RMS pruning molecular symmetry will be taken into account. Note that for reasons of computation efficiency, when this option is enabled only heavy atoms will be used in the RMS calculation.

option.name: Embed fragments separately

tab.option: Embed each of the molecule's fragments individually. Each fragment will be centered at the origin (i.e. the fragments will overlap). When this option is disabled, the fragments will not overlap but attractive inter-fragment interactions (e.g. H-bonds) are not taken into account.

option.name: Use random coordinates as a starting point instead of distance geometry

tab.option: Setting this flag will use random coordinates as a starting point instead of distance geometry.

option.name: Multiplier for the size of the box for random coordinates

tab.option: Specifies a multiplier for the size of the box for random coordinates.

option.name: Perform a cleanup using UFF (Universal force field) after calculation

tab.option: Set this flag to perform cleanup with UFF after the conformer's calculation. Just clear this flag to output unprocessed conformers in case you want to perform other processing on them before cleaning them up with a force field.
